Claim: Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.
Explaination: Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.

Explanation:Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-this-covid-19-patient-is-not-the-wife-of-canadian-pm-justin-trudeau-1658145-2020-03-21

Claim: Coronavirus cases linked to 5G rollout.
Explaination: Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus cases linked to 5G rollout.

Explanation:Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472036-fact-check-coronavirus-cases-in-us-not-linked-to-5g-rollout.html

Claim: A photo shows the newly built hospital in Wuhan.
Explaination: The viral image was taken from an online listing and is actually a modular apartment building.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A photo shows the newly built hospital in Wuhan.

Explanation:The viral image was taken from an online listing and is actually a modular apartment building.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14679223

Claim: Six coronavirus cases confirmed in Wichita, Kansas.
Explaination: No cases were confirmed there, and claim came from non-credible websites.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Six coronavirus cases confirmed in Wichita, Kansas.

Explanation:No cases were confirmed there, and claim came from non-credible websites.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471725-fake-news-breaking-news-six-coronavirus-cases-confirmed-in-wichita-kansas.html

Claim: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.
Explaination: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.

Explanation:Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/vitamin-c-supplementation-does-not-prevent-viral-respiratory-infections-such-as-those-caused-by-coronaviruses-in-the-general-population/?check=1

Claim: Facebook posts shared thousands of times feature a video of U.S. officials talking to reporters, with captions claiming they are announcing the arrest of a Chinese scientist.
Explaination: However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Facebook posts shared thousands of times feature a video of U.S. officials talking to reporters, with captions claiming they are announcing the arrest of a Chinese scientist.

Explanation:However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.

https://factcheck.afp.com/facebook-posts-falsely-claim-us-arrested-chinese-scientist-who-created-coronavirus

Claim: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in the Macarthur Region of Australia.
Explaination: This story has not been reported by 7NEWS Sydney news, nor any other news outlets,(7News Sydney confirmed with us).
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in the Macarthur Region of Australia.

Explanation:This story has not been reported by 7NEWS Sydney news, nor any other news outlets,(7News Sydney confirmed with us).

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/04/there-is-no-new-confirmed-case-of-coronavirus-in-the-macarthur-region-in-australia/

Claim: Punjab authorities have advised citizens not to eat goat meat for 60 days.
Explaination: China coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Punjab authorities have advised citizens not to eat goat meat for 60 days.

Explanation:China coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat.

http://u.afp.com/PakistanGoats

Claim: These charts show the difference betweem COVID-19, flu and common cold.
Explaination: Charts include inaccurate information about symptoms. They claim people suffering from the novel coronavirus do not develop some symptoms seen in flu or common cold patients, such as a runny or stuffy nose, a sore throat, vomiting, diarrhea and muscle pain, among others -- most of which can actually be seen among COVID-19 patients as well.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: These charts show the difference betweem COVID-19, flu and common cold.

Explanation:Charts include inaccurate information about symptoms. They claim people suffering from the novel coronavirus do not develop some symptoms seen in flu or common cold patients, such as a runny or stuffy nose, a sore throat, vomiting, diarrhea and muscle pain, among others -- most of which can actually be seen among COVID-19 patients as well.

https://medium.com/annie-lab/misleading-these-charts-about-covid-19-contain-inaccurate-medical-information-53ad9167ad3c

Claim: In Japan, “It’s the Democratic party’s fault that health insurance system is abused by foreigners”
Explaination: According to Japan Tourism Agency, this information is false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In Japan, “It’s the Democratic party’s fault that health insurance system is abused by foreigners”

Explanation:According to Japan Tourism Agency, this information is false.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/noganisarerugaharikoronauirusunisi

Claim: COVID-19 is the name of the vaccine against the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: A blog post claiming that the World Health Organization has announced COVID-19 as a vaccine against the novel coronavirus has a false headline. There is no vaccine yet for the disease.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: COVID-19 is the name of the vaccine against the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:A blog post claiming that the World Health Organization has announced COVID-19 as a vaccine against the novel coronavirus has a false headline. There is no vaccine yet for the disease.

https://pesacheck.org/false-headline-covid-19-is-not-a-vaccine-against-novel-coronavirus-ef14477bb51a

Claim: A video of dozens of people praying outdoors shows Italians praying during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows a prayer event in Peru in December 2019, weeks before Italy reported its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of dozens of people praying outdoors shows Italians praying during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage in fact shows a prayer event in Peru in December 2019, weeks before Italy reported its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-actually-shows-worshippers-peru-2019-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s while the Simpsons picture was edited.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s while the Simpsons picture was edited.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/did-the-simpsons-and-comic-series-asterix-predict-the-2019-coronavirus-outbreak-6867

Claim: Says COVID-19 remains in the air for eight hours and that everyone is now required to wear masks “everywhere.”
Explaination: There are different definitions of what is considered “airborne,” and while COVID-19 is spread through the air via droplets, it isn’t believed to be as transmissible as typical airborne illnesses, such as measles. There is no evidence that the virus stays in the air for eight hours and there is no requirement for “everyone” to wear masks everywhere.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Says COVID-19 remains in the air for eight hours and that everyone is now required to wear masks “everywhere.”

Explanation:There are different definitions of what is considered “airborne,” and while COVID-19 is spread through the air via droplets, it isn’t believed to be as transmissible as typical airborne illnesses, such as measles. There is no evidence that the virus stays in the air for eight hours and there is no requirement for “everyone” to wear masks everywhere.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/02/facebook-posts/fact-checking-claims-say-covid-19-airborne/

Claim: Turmeric and lemon can cure the coronavirus.
Explaination: Medical practitioners and even WHO has rubbished this claim and has said that there is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon can be used to cure coronavirus.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Turmeric and lemon can cure the coronavirus.

Explanation:Medical practitioners and even WHO has rubbished this claim and has said that there is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon can be used to cure coronavirus.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/turmeric-and-lemon-help-fight-coronavirus-heres-the-truth-fake-news-doctors-explain

Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.
Explaination: This video is of riots that happened in Peckham, London. With the help of Google search, we found several global media reports on the London riots. It was clear from these reports that the video viral on social media is the London riots that happened in 2011.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.

Explanation:This video is of riots that happened in Peckham, London. With the help of Google search, we found several global media reports on the London riots. It was clear from these reports that the video viral on social media is the London riots that happened in 2011.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15320709?check=2

Claim: Homemade masks prevent the spread of coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Homemade masks prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.

https://factcheck.afp.com/these-photos-show-aftermath-powerful-earthquake-croatia?check=1

Claim: Cow urine cures coronavirus.
Explaination: In our verification, we found several media reports, research reports, and advisories that talk about prevention and cure of the disease but there was no mention of cow urine and dung in these reports hence the claim made by the Hindu Mahasabha president Swami Chakrapani is ‘Misleading’.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Cow urine cures coronavirus.

Explanation:In our verification, we found several media reports, research reports, and advisories that talk about prevention and cure of the disease but there was no mention of cow urine and dung in these reports hence the claim made by the Hindu Mahasabha president Swami Chakrapani is ‘Misleading’.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14743340

Claim: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”
Explaination: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."
Label: Not true
html:
Claim: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”

Explanation:Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471529-fake-news-patent-for-coronavirus-that-expired-is-not-for-new-strain-killing-people-in-china.html

Claim: Hospitals don’t allow parents to visit children with COVID-19 in the hospital.
Explaination: Hospital policies have become generally more restrictive, but pediatric patients are still allowed visits by at least one parent.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Hospitals don’t allow parents to visit children with COVID-19 in the hospital.

Explanation:Hospital policies have become generally more restrictive, but pediatric patients are still allowed visits by at least one parent.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/meme-misleads-on-hospital-visits-to-children-with-covid-19/

Claim: A video shows that after drinking snake blood during training in Thailand, US soldiers went to Wuhan for the Military World Games. The US soldiers were the intermediate hosts of COVID-19.
Explaination: The video was about the co-training event of the Cobra Gold exercise originally filmed by Reuters on March 4, 2020. However, the 7th Military World Games, which took place in Wuhan, happened in October 2019, prior to the training.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows that after drinking snake blood during training in Thailand, US soldiers went to Wuhan for the Military World Games. The US soldiers were the intermediate hosts of COVID-19.

Explanation:The video was about the co-training event of the Cobra Gold exercise originally filmed by Reuters on March 4, 2020. However, the 7th Military World Games, which took place in Wuhan, happened in October 2019, prior to the training.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3580

Claim: People queue in Singapore for Halal food.
Explaination: They are queuing for masks.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: People queue in Singapore for Halal food.

Explanation:They are queuing for masks.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-reports-about-people-queuing-masks-singapore-after-novel-coronavirus-outbreak

Claim: Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.
Explaination: The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.
Label: Partially false
html:
Claim: Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.

Explanation:The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3162

Claim: Broiler chickens were found to have coronavirus in Mumbai.
Explaination: Chickens have not been identified as the source for the coronavirus so far and the attached pictures are not linked to coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Broiler chickens were found to have coronavirus in Mumbai.

Explanation:Chickens have not been identified as the source for the coronavirus so far and the attached pictures are not linked to coronavirus.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/false-coronavirus-found-in-broiler-chickens-6757

Claim: Thai department of health published an infographic on how to properly wear face masks.
Explaination: MOH denied.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Thai department of health published an infographic on how to properly wear face masks.

Explanation:MOH denied.

http://u.afp.com/ThaiFaceMasks

Claim: Initial lack of evidence for human-to-human COVID-19 transmission unusual.
Explaination: We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not know to the transmission being human-to-human
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Initial lack of evidence for human-to-human COVID-19 transmission unusual.

Explanation:We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not know to the transmission being human-to-human

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472050-fact-check-initial-lack-of-evidence-for-human-to-human-COVID-2019-transmission-not-unusual.html

Claim: The novel coronavirus “will not spread” in the Philippines due to the country’s high temperature and relatively high humidity.
Explaination: In an email response to this claim, the World Health Organization (WHO) told Rappler that 2019-nCoV "has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates, as well as cold and dry."
Label: False
html:
Claim: The novel coronavirus “will not spread” in the Philippines due to the country’s high temperature and relatively high humidity.

Explanation:In an email response to this claim, the World Health Organization (WHO) told Rappler that 2019-nCoV "has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates, as well as cold and dry."

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251554-novel-coronavirus-will-not-spread-philippines-due-high-temperature-humidity

Claim: Tweet says Daniel Radcliffe has the coronavirus.
Explaination: A fake BBC Twitter account spread the claim before the tweet was removed and the account suspended from the platform.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Tweet says Daniel Radcliffe has the coronavirus.

Explanation:A fake BBC Twitter account spread the claim before the tweet was removed and the account suspended from the platform.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/11/tweets/no-daniel-radcliffe-does-not-have-coronavirus/

Claim: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.
Explaination: The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.

Explanation:The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256810-video-clip-dead-bodies-coronavirus-patients-italy

Claim: A video shows the effects of coronavirus and suggest people avoid ice cream and cold drinks for 90 days.
Explaination: Video shown in the viral post showing a person removing larvae from the lips using a pair of tweezers is old and unrelated to coronavirus. The claim in the viral post is also refuted by medical professionals.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows the effects of coronavirus and suggest people avoid ice cream and cold drinks for 90 days.

Explanation:Video shown in the viral post showing a person removing larvae from the lips using a pair of tweezers is old and unrelated to coronavirus. The claim in the viral post is also refuted by medical professionals.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-misinformation-related-to-coronavirus-outbreak-getting-viral/

Claim: Whether coronavirus began with man having sex with a bat.
Explaination: This came from a clear satire website as fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether coronavirus began with man having sex with a bat.

Explanation:This came from a clear satire website as fake.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Coronavirus-'Patient-Zero'-Is-NOT-A-Man-Who-Had-Sex-With-A-Bat.html

Claim: Former NYC Mayor Rudolph Giuliani said he “bought $2M in shares of Novartis, a primary supplier of hydroxychloroquine” in early February.
Explaination: While Novartis paid Giuliani a speaker’s fee in 2006, there is no publicly available evidence that he currently has a financial stake in the company. He has denied having one in press reports.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Former NYC Mayor Rudolph Giuliani said he “bought $2M in shares of Novartis, a primary supplier of hydroxychloroquine” in early February.

Explanation:While Novartis paid Giuliani a speaker’s fee in 2006, there is no publicly available evidence that he currently has a financial stake in the company. He has denied having one in press reports.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/09/tweets/fact-checking-rudy-giulianis-ties-hydroxychloroqui/

Claim: Posts circulating on social media claim that Ugandan and Kenyan authorities have instructed landlords to stop collecting rent due to the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posts circulating on social media claim that Ugandan and Kenyan authorities have instructed landlords to stop collecting rent due to the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.

https://factcheck.afp.com/ugandan-and-kenyan-authorities-reject-claims-they-told-landlords-stop-rent-collection

Claim: Lemon and bicarbonate can cure coronavirus.
Explaination: Doctors and experts suggest that there is no medical evidence to corroborate the claim.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Lemon and bicarbonate can cure coronavirus.

Explanation:Doctors and experts suggest that there is no medical evidence to corroborate the claim.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/unverified-message-claims-israel-has-found-the-cure-for-covid-19-fake-news-fact-check

Claim: Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding so “Dems could campaign on it.”
Explaination: President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on March 6. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill solely to run political ads.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding so “Dems could campaign on it.”

Explanation:President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on March 6. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill solely to run political ads.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/10/blog-posting/fact-checking-claims-pelosi-held-coronavirus-aid/

Claim: Ecuadorean youtuber Raùl Alvarez Guene supposedly infected with COVID-19.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Ecuadorean youtuber Raùl Alvarez Guene supposedly infected with COVID-19.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/
